definition[0]: to mix together, or to make different things do this
example[0]: Many towns allow recyclable items to be commingled for collection in a single container.
definition[1]: if a financial organization commingles money, it mixes its own money with money that belongs to its customers or to another part of the business, usually in an illegal way
example[1]: The company faces charges that it commingled its own funds with customer funds.
